author: IGN
description: Check out the Rex Splode Developer Fighter Deep Dive Trailer for Invincible VS, the upcoming fighting game based on the Invincible IP, developed by Quarter Up. Rex Splode wields an abrasive attitude with a huge heart alongside his lethal combat abilities that center around his explosive projectiles and quick movements to make up for his inability to fly. Get the rundown on Rex Splode's moves, abilities, and techniques with the developers for Invincible VS, launching in 2026 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam).
title: Invincible VS - Official Rex Splode Overview Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Valiant Tactics is releasing on Steam August 4th! – https://bit.ly/ValiantTacticsTrailer

Command your forces and outsmart your enemies in a turn-based tactics roguelike where every move matters and every run is a new battle for glory.

🛡️ Recruit unique heroes and build your squad
 ⚔️ Outmaneuver foes in grid-based tactical combat
 🗺️ Conquer procedurally generated campaigns

With its blend of strategic depth, pixel-art charm, and endless replayability, Valiant Tactics is the ultimate challenge for tacticians and roguelike fans alike.

🎮 Wishlist Now: https://bit.ly/ValiantTacticsTrailer

#ValiantTactics #IndieGame #TurnBasedTactics
title: Valiant Tactics - Official Release Date Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Watch the 'Crafting Fantastic Four' Featurette for The Fantastic Four: First Steps, the next installment to the MCU and introduction to Marvel's First Family. Join key individuals part of the development of the film from Director Matt Shakman, Executive Producer Tim Lewis, and the cast on what it was like to create a Fantastic Four film that not only calls back to the optimistic era of the 1960s, but a great keystone of the modern era. The Fantastic Four: First Steps is in theaters on July 25.

The Fantastic Four: First Steps stars Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, Ralph Ineson, and Julia Garner. The Fantastic Four: First Steps opens in theaters on July 25, 2025.

Set against the vibrant backdrop of a 1960s-inspired, retro- futuristic world, Marvel Studios’ The Fantastic Four: First Steps introduces Marvel’s First Family—Reed Richards/Mister Fantastic (Pedro Pascal), Sue Storm/Invisible Woman (Vanessa Kirby), Johnny Storm/Human Torch (Joseph Quinn) and Ben
title: The Fantastic Four: First Steps - Official 'Crafting Fantastic Four' Behind the Scenes Clip (2025)

author: IGN
description:
This Metroidvania is full of twisty paths, tough enemies, and more than a few "wait, what do I do now?" moments. Luckily, IGN’s Arielle Danan has spent a full week inside the labyrinth and is here to guide you through it. From dodging tips and devour mechanics to hilarious movement tricks, we’re covering everything that’ll help you survive and thrive.

In this video, you’ll learn the best ways to dodge and reposition during combat, why hit-and-run tactics are essential for surviving tougher enemies, how to make use of the enemy log to find weaknesses, when and how enemies respawn, and even how to master secret movement tricks to get an edge in exploration and boss fights. There’s also advice for achievement hunters and newcomers wondering when to worry about collectibles!

00:00 - Intro  
00:27 - Dodge, Dodge, Dodge  
00:54 - Hit and Run  
01:11 - Read The Enemy Description  
01:25 - Enemy Respawns  
01:39 - Getting a Better View  
01:49 - Yummy…Enemies  
02:03 - For Achievement Hunte
title: Shadow Labyrinth: Early Tips and Tricks to Get You Started!

author: IGN
description: Check out the 'Designing Vex' Beyond The Borderlands #4 for Borderlands 4, the next installment in the first-person action looter shooter RPG developed by Gearbox. Players can go behind the scenes and hear from character and VFX artists on how the Dark Siren of Borderlands 4, Vex, was designed from concept to final design. Learn more about Vex in Borderlands 4, launching on September 12 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC (Steam).
title: Borderlands 4 - Official 'Designing Vex' Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Get ready to soak up the sun -- Marvel-style! This video showcases every Marvel Rivals Summer Special skin released so far, bringing vacation vibes to your favorite heroes and villains. From Luna Snow’s Cool Summer look to Thor’s Worthy Waves, we’ve got everything that’s been released so far!

But that’s not all — we’re also showing off the new MVP screens and all available color customizations so you know exactly what you’re spending those Unstable Molecules on. Whether you're planning your next main or just want to see how stylish these summer skins really are, this video has you covered!

01:39 - The Thing - Sunshine Thing

02:44 - Thor - Worthy Waves
03:15 - Summer Special Pass Rewards (Stickers, Emojis, Banners)

#IGN #Gaming #MarvelRivals
title: Marvel Rivals Update: All Summer Special Skins So Far in 4K (Swimsuits, Emotes, MVP Screens)

Check out the Bober the Beaver Visit Castor Woods Trailer for Dying Light: The Beast, an upcoming action first-person zombie game developed by Techland. Players can explore the region of Castor Woods with Bober the Beaver leading the tour. Fight the undead amongst the scenic views and lush greenery in Dying Light: The Beast, launching on August 22 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam and Epic Games Store).

#IGN #Gaming
title: Dying Light: The Beast - Official Bober the Beaver Visit Castor Woods Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Persona5: The Phantom X reviewed by Sarah Thwaites on PC, also available on mobile.

Persona5: The Phantom X is a stylish, thoughtfully written reimagining of Persona 5 that struggles to feel sincere under the weight of its gacha systems. Early on, it’s thoroughly enjoyable to bounce around the vibrant reimagining of Tokyo and help out the small pool of lovable NPCs. Eventually, though, the patience-testing roadblocks and onslaught of low-stakes activities amount to little more than a beautiful but taxing slog. With a ton of excellent Persona games to play elsewhere that don’t artificially hold you at arm’s length, it’s fair to say that my relationship with Lufel and the gang will remain in the acquaintances category, rather than best buds.
title: Persona5: The Phantom X Review

author: IGN
description:
After a mother and son get in a car wreck, they soon become hunted by Bambi, a mutated grief-stricken deer on a deadly rampage seeking revenge for the death of his mother.

Bambi: The Reckoning features Roxanne McKee (TV’s “Game of Thrones”), Nicola Wright (Winnie-The-Pooh: Blood and Honey 2), Russell Geoffrey Banks (Who’s Watching Oliver), Tom Mulheron (TV’s “Slow Horses”), and Samira Mighty (TV’s “Love Island”). 

Directed by Dan Allen and written by Rhys Warrington, Bambi: The Reckoning arrives in theaters on July 25, 2025 by Seismic Releasing, Jagged Edge Productions and ITN Distribution.

It is produced by Rhys Frake-Waterfield and Scott Chambers (Winnie-The-Pooh: Blood and Honey 1 & 2) and executive produced by Stuart Alson (Winnie-The-Pooh: Blood and Honey 1 & 2) and Nicole Holland (Winnie-The-Pooh: Blood and Honey 1 & 2).

#IGN #Movies
title: Bambi: The Reckoning - Exclusive Clip (2025)

author: IGN
description:
Join IGN’s Alan Knight as he plays through some of the initial gameplay of NTE (Neverness to Evenness).

Jumping in after the tutorial missions, Alan is exploring Hethreau, racing through the city streets, and fighting dangerous anomalies. After a mysterious event leads the protagonist to join forces with the Bureau of Anomaly Control, they’re assigned to the Eibon Antique Shop to train and become the strongest Anomaly Hunter there is!

Presented by NTE, pre-register now at  NTE.PerfectWorld.com
title: NTE Gameplay - An Anime Supernatural Open-World RPG

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Launch Trailer for Shadow Labyrinth, a 2D action platformer developed by Bandai Namco Games. Players will arise as Swordsman No. 8, accompanied by an orb named PUCK to explore the planet and battle evolved monsters to progress. Travel through wrapping mazes to become the apex predator in Shadow Labyrinth, available now for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC (Steam).

#IGN #ShadowLabyrinth #BandaiNamco
title: Shadow Labyrinth - Official Launch Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Join Alex Jordan (the voice of Jan) to learn 11 facts about The Alters in this new trailer for the sci-fi survival adventure game. The Alters is available now on PC, PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and day one on Xbox Game Pass and PC Game Pass.

After crash-landing on a hostile planet under a blazing sun, Jan must survive in a high-tech mobile base designed for a crew he doesn’t have. His luck changes when he discovers Rapidium, a resource that, when paired with the Quantum Computer, lets him create Alters—alternate versions of himself based on changing the pivotal decisions from his past.

The Alters aren’t just workers—they’re individuals with their own skills, emotions, and motivations. While essential for keeping the base functional, crafting tools, and mining resources, their distinct personalities can spark tension. Despite their differences, they share a common goal: survive, escape, and rely only on themselves.

#IGN
title: The Alters - Official 11 Facts Trailer

author: IGN
description:
This video showcases the first 20 minutes of gameplay from Shadow Labyrinth running on PlayStation 5 Pro, including the full opening, side-scrolling combat, and an awesome look at Pac-Man-style gameplay. All footage captured in 4K at 60 frames per second. Whether you're curious about the game's story, visuals, or fast-paced action, this is the perfect intro to what Shadow Labyrinth has to offer.

Shadow Labyrinth is available on PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via Steam on July 18, 2025.

author: IGN
description:
Welcome back to Next-Gen Console Watch! This week the team discuss IGN's first 10 out of 10 game of the year: Donkey Kong Bananza. Nintendo Voice Chat's Logan Plant, who reviewed the game, stops by to elaborate on his glowing score. We also look on the PS5 and Xbox side to see what would be those consoles' definitive "killer app" titles. Plus we have last week's poll results, and a new poll for you to vote on at IGN.com.

#IGN #Gaming #NintendoSwitch2
title: Donkey Kong Bananza Is Switch 2’s Killer App - Next-Gen Console Watch

author: IGN
description:
Check out the red band teaser trailer for Fixed, an upcoming adult animated comedy from director Genndy Tartakovsky. Fixed stars Adam Devine, Idris Elba, Kathryn Hahn, Fred Armisen, Bobby Moynihan, Beck Bennett, Michelle Buteau and River Gallo . 

From visionary director Genndy Tartakovsky comes “Fixed,” an adult animated comedy about Bull, an average, all-around good dog who discovers he’s going to be neutered in the morning! As the gravity of this life-altering event sets in, Bull realizes he needs one last adventure with his pack of best friends as these are the last 24 hours with his balls! What could go wrong...?

The Fixed screenplay is by Genndy Tartakovsky and Jon Vitti. The story is by Steve Greenberg, Rich Lufrano, Genndy Tartakovsky and Jon Vitti. It is produced by Michelle Murdocca. It is co-produced by Christian Roedel. The production is by Sony Pictures Animation.

Fixed releases on Netflix on August 13, 2025.
title: Fixed: Director’s Cut - Official Red Band Teaser (2025) Adam Devine, Idris Elba, Kathryn Hahn

author: IGN
description: Don't miss the Extended Gameplay Trailer for Echoes of the End, an upcoming action-adventure third-person game developed by Mrykur Games. Players will embark on a perilous journey as Ryn to save her brother, prevent a pending war, and reveal the hidden secrets and history of Aema. Take a look at the latest trailer to see gameplay and get a new look at different enemy types, traversal challenges, and environmental encounters across Chapter 2 with intense combat at the forefront. Echoes of the End is launching on August 12 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam).
title: Echoes of the End - Official Extended Gameplay Trailer

author: IGN
description: Here's your look at gameplay and more from Wretch: Divine Ascent in this trailer for the upcoming 1v1 tactical auto battler game with elements of roguelike mechanics and backpack management in a dark medieval art style. Wretch: Divine Ascent is inspired by Backpack Battles and developed with Unreal Engine. Create your own unique attack combos by arranging items in your backpack to connect moves. Wretch: Divine Ascent will be available on PC in October 2025, and a demo is out now on Steam.
title: Wretch: Divine Ascent - Official Release Window Trailer
